website_summaries.verdict: The reviews for the Altra Duo 1.5 have been divisive. There are people who like this shoe a lot, saying that it is a comfortable and well-made product. But there are also those who feel that it is not as described. The upper unit, in particular, is a highlighted area because while some say that the fabrics and design are accommodating, others complained that they’re only sources of skin irritation.The Altra Duo 1.5 is intended for neutral pronators who like to take to the roads.
pros: The breathability of the Altra Duo 1.5’s upper unit is praised by those who like a well-ventilated ride
Some testers feel that the shoelaces are long and stretchy enough to accommodate small and significant adjustments to the fit
The toe box is praised by purchasers
they report that it is spacious and able to boost the quality of the toe-off
According to a handful of consumers, the midsole foam is able to responsibly attenuate the impact forces generated by the foot-strike
The flexibility of this product is lauded by Altra fans
The traction capacity of the outsole is considered reliable and precise
cons: Several testers have detested the design of this product, stating that the look isn’t too appealing to the eyes
A couple of users report that the thin tongue unit has a tendency to bunch up and cause irritation
The edges of the collar are deemed sources of scratches against the ankles and heel
A break-in period of several uses is apparently needed before achieving full-comfort, based on some reviews
According to a few runners, the upper unit near the forefoot is quick to separate from the sole piece

customer_reviews.title: Less than a perfect replacement for Paradigm
customer_reviews.text: For whatever reason I came home with two bloodied heels the first time out. I think the material the uppers are made out of is so flimsy it clings to my socks (more than my socks cling to my feet) forcing my socks to rub against my heels. I used clear glossy packaging tape on the inside of the heel and things are fine now. My Paradigm and Olympus shoes never gave me any trouble. I would have gotten Paradigms again but their arch supports are too high to suit me. Perhaps Altra should include a roll of tape with every pair
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Same Altra feel.
customer_reviews.text: Let's start to say they are Altra running shoes for $49 (I bought the gray ones). You are gonna get what you pay for. They have the same cushioning and wide toe box they are famous for. The upper material is what I would compare to a water shoe, very thin. I bought these for indoor workouts on the treadmill and have put about 30 miles on them so far. They will last a long time doing that. I don't suspect they will last as long for an outdoor road shoe but that will even come down to each individual runner and conditions. They have met my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor heel cup design
customer_reviews.text: The design of the heel cup is not good. A weird, stiff material that gave me bad blisters on my Achilles tendon. I have worn many different Altra shoes for thousands of miles and never ran into this issue... but none of my other Altras had suck a poor heel cup design. It is not padded at all- it is a thin, hard material with a seam sewn right at the Achilles. Returned them after one six mile run. Other than the heel, the rest of the shoe was great.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J Painter

customer_reviews.title: Exploded my ankle
customer_reviews.text: Tried transitioning from minimal running shoes to this. The high stack and low closure made me twist my ankle 3 times on first run. I cannot feel the road/ground and shoe closure too forward on my foot. I am returning them. But, they look great, seem well made, fit my wide feet well, I just can't actually use them for running
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have had hip pain for many months. When I bought these shoes, hip pain disappeared, even though I have walked 3 miles/day since purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ghshaw

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: Felt like this pair of Altras were cheaply made compared to all of the other (5 pairs) of previous Altras that I have owned! Highly disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: John P. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: comfy but support is fading
customer_reviews.text: nice comfort and cushy. seems as i wear the shoes more the support has a tendency to allow my foot to slip off to one side. maybe just the way I walk
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good looking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Shoe was not what I expected too small and heel was uncomfortable. Returned product.
customer_reviews.author: James Visger

customer_reviews.title: not enough support for the foot.
customer_reviews.text: side supports are very thin and had zero cushions. I wear size 10 and usually have a finger space but this shoe was tight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst tongue design ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy tongue creases and folds when putting on shoe. Terrible design. Stick with Paradigm.
customer_reviews.author: Edward W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes for the price
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are comfortable on the soles, but very thin on support above the heal (no padding). Because of this, the shoes were slightly too large, but easily fixed with a second pair of socks. Other than that, totally worth the price point. I am a huge fan of the wide toe box.
customer_reviews.author: DMack

customer_reviews.title: Altra Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Altra shoes are perfect for walking, running or cross-training. Very comfortable & light.
customer_reviews.author: Donald J. Freeman

customer_reviews.title: These are not your basic running shoes
customer_reviews.text: THESE ARE NOT CASUAL RUNNING SHOES or WALKING SHOES. Just because these have a thick stack height does not mean they are meant to slog along on your 10 minute miles. These are racing shoes. I wear them for longer slower runs but they feel best at 7:30 or faster. They may work for you at slower paces but don't be surprised if they don't feel right. Like many have said, I had some blistered achilles on the first run. I used some thicker socks and put Band-Aids on my achilles the skin was healing and once the shoes were broken in things were fine. The juice was worth the squeeze for me because I really liked the Duo.
customer_reviews.author: Carsen R McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: I'd maybe buy them for less than $50
customer_reviews.text: These are comfy shoes. Kind of a different tongue of the shoe. The problem is the back cuts into your heel. If you loosen the laces then your heel slips out. Maybe if you get them for cheap and wear at least quarter length socks they would be a decent walking around or work shoe.
customer_reviews.author: luke

product_meta.title: ALTRA mens Duo 1.5
product_meta.description: The race day max-cushioned rocket is back with an all new engineered knit upper equipped with an updated heel collar and strategic knitting pattern for a more secure but breathable foot surround. The MAX-LT cushion continues to provide the speedy but very light cushioning and has been paired with a more durable outsole rubber to allow for more race day excursions.
